title: Fonts from the Newspaper
content: I am designing a mini-book that i will be typesetting my senior paper into, which is about crossword puzzles, and I am really struggling with the typeface choice. I am currently using Ehrhardt but it seems too heavy on the grey paper I am printing on. I think i started with Century, which again was just too heavy. I don't quite want to go with the obvious Times New Roman. Does anyone have any suggestions on faces the would lend the "newspaper" look to my mini-book?
author: track and kern

comments.content:
Lido by Storm, a Times-inspired type designed for a Czech newspaper. And it's free. But, by all means, spend some money with Storm. Tons of excellence there. His Andulka would work too.  
 [http://www.stormtype.com/free.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140125042840/http:/www.stormtype.com/free.html "http://www.stormtype.com/free.html")
I second the Lido notion. It prints better on newsprint than many expensive text faces and it's definitely got more character than Times.

[Freight Micro](http://web.archive.org/web/20140125042840/http:/www.joshuadarden.com/shop/freightmicro.php) or [Eldorado Micro](http://web.archive.org/web/20140125042840/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Eldorado/styles) could be fun.

[Celeste Small Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20140125042840/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FF.11068.0.0) has a lot of versatility.

Do not forget to include 2 of these Flower Crosswords:  
 [http://www.CrAUSwords.com/flowers/WFlowers.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20140125042840/http:/www.crauswords.com/flowers/WFlowers.htm "http://www.CrAUSwords.com/flowers/WFlowers.htm")  
All the Best.
